tool.name: PeakPickerIterative
tool.description: Finds mass spectrometric peaks in profile mass spectra.
tool.command:
@QUOTE_FOO@ @EXT_FOO@ #import re
## Preprocessing mkdir in && ln -s '$in' 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' && mkdir out &&
## Main program call
set -o pipefail && @EXECUTABLE@ -write_ctd ./ && python3 '$__tool_directory__/fill_ctd.py' '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$args_json' '$hardcoded_json' && @EXECUTABLE@ -ini @EXECUTABLE@.ctd -in 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' -out 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("mzml")}'
## Postprocessing && mv 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("mzml")}' '$out' #if "ctd_out_FLAG" in $OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS && mv '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$ctd_out' #end if

param.label: Signal to noise value, each peak is required to be above this value (turn off by setting it to 0.0)
Expected peak width half width in Dalton - peaks will be extended until this half width is reached (even if the intensitity is increasing)
param.help: In conjunction with check_width_internally it will also be used to remove peaks whose spacing is larger than this value

param.label: Difference between peaks in multiples of the minimal difference to continue
param.help: The higher this value is set, the further apart peaks are allowed to be to still extend a peak. E.g. if the value is set to 1.5 and in a current peak the minimal spacing between peaks is 10 mDa, then only peaks at most 15 mDa apart will be added to the peak

param.label: Bin count for the Signal to Noise estimation
Nr of iterations to perform (how many times the peaks are re-centered)
Window length for the Signal to Noise estimation
Delete peaks where the spacing is larger than the peak width (should be set to true to avoid artefacts)
Delete meta data about peak width
Enables the test mode (needed for internal use only)

data.name: ctd_out
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: ctd
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "ctd_out_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

tool.help:
Finds mass spectrometric peaks in profile mass spectra.
For more information, visit http://www.openms.de/doxygen/nightly/html/UTILS_PeakPickerIterative.html
